content.title: Endovenous Laser Ablation (EVLA)
content.description: Minimally invasive endovenous thermal ablation using laser energy to occlude incompetent superficial veins.
content.mechanism: Laser energy absorbed by hemoglobin and water causes intraluminal heating, endothelial destruction, and vein occlusion

wavelengths.810nm_940nm: First generation, absorbed by hemoglobin, more post-procedure pain
wavelengths.1320nm_1470nm: Second generation, absorbed by water, less bruising and pain

procedure.tumescent: Essential for thermal protection and vein compression
procedure.energy_delivery: Linear endovenous energy density (LEED) typically 60-80 J/cm

evla_vs_rfa.pain: EVLA may have more post-procedure discomfort (older wavelengths)
evla_vs_rfa.cost: Laser fibers single-use, catheters reusable for RFA

complications.EHIT: Endovenous heat-induced thrombosis (extension into deep vein)
